page.title: 13MRS. JENKINSON
page.content: My grandma was born in 1921 in the village of wadworth. She went to school till 14 years old and when she was 16 she went into private service at Wilsic hall. A few years later she went into a factory making silk. At that time we only had one little grocery shop in the village and Lucy Frost owned it. Every Tuesday and Saturday Mr. Sackston would go to the village of Tickhill and get her any things she wanted. He would come with the delivery on a horse and cart. On the 22 of December 1945 remarried at Wadworth church and lived at the second cottage in High street. Three years later she got married again on March sixth 1948 at the church. The vicar was M.T. Sanderson. Then she lived at 32 church view now she lives alone at 14 Ratten Row both husbands having died in mining accidents.
